measure_info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
measure_info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
measure_info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

measure_info.short_description: Drive time to the nearest 2-year schools.
measure_info.long_description: Minimal drive time to a school authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
measure_info.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a 2-year school from {features.name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

measure_info.short_description: Number of <2-year schools per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
measure_info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) <2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
measure_info.statement: There are {value} <2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

measure_info.long_description: Minimal drive time to a schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
measure_info.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a <2-year school from {features.name}'s block group centroids on average.

measure_info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with biomedical programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
measure_info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with biomedical programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 26) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 26, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
measure_info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a biomedical program per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

measure_info.long_name: Median percentage of 3rd graders passing reading test
measure_info.short_description: Median percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test for schools in the region
measure_info.long_description: Median percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test. The median is calculated across schools in the region.
measure_info.statement: On average, {value} of 3rd graders pass reading in {features.name}.

measure_info.long_name: Mean percentage of 3rd graders passing reading test
measure_info.short_description: Mean percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test for schools in the region
measure_info.long_description: Mean percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test. The median is calculated across schools in the region.
measure_info.statement: In most regions, {value} of 3rd graders pass reading in {features.name}.
